msgr 1.0.1
  • Reference

Reference

Create messages, warnings and errors

These functions create messages and write them to a log file

info()

Display a message, and record it in a log file.

warn()

Display a warning, and record it in a log file.

error()

Display an error, and record it in a log file.

Create messages, warnings and errors, if a condition is met

These functions create messages and write them to a log file

info_if()

Display a message, and record in a log file, if a condition is true.

warn_if()

Display a warning, and record in a log file, if a condition is true.

error_if()

Display an error, and record in a log file, if a condition is true.

assert()

Display an error, and record in a log file, if a condition is false

Try expressions and catch errors

These functions catch errors and write them to a log file

try_catch()

Try to evaluate an expressions and capture any messages, warnings or errors

try_map()

Apply a function over a vector or list, capturing any errors to display at the end

try_pmap()

Apply a function over a list of vectors, capturing any errors to display at the end

Predicate functions for vectors and scalars

These functions help specify conditions

is_vector()

Checks whether the variable is an atomic vector

is_scalar()

Checks whether the variable is an atomic vector of length 1

is_logical()

Checks whether the variable is a logical vector

is_boolean()

Checks whether the variable is a logical vector of length 1

is_numeric()

Checks whether the variable is a numeric vector

is_number()

Checks whether the variable is a numeric vector of length 1

is_integer()

Checks whether the variable is a numeric vector of integers

is_natural()

Checks whether the variable is a natural number

is_character()

Checks whether the variable is a character vector

is_string()

Checks whether the variable is a character vector of length 1

Predicate functions for non-vectors

These functions help specify conditions

is_list()

Checks whether the variable is a list

is_data_frame()

Checks whether the variable is a data frame

is_function()

Checks whether the variable is a function

is_null()

Checks whether the variable is NULL

is_na()

Checks whether the variable is NA

is_in()

Checks whether all elements of one variable are in another

has_names()

Checks whether the variable has names

Predicate functions for files and folders

These functions help specify conditions

is_url()

Checks whether the variable is a valid URL

is_dir()

Checks whether the variable is a path to an existing directory

is_file()

Checks whether the variable is a path to an existing file

is_readable()

Checks whether the variable is a path to an existing, readable file or directory

is_writeable()

Checks whether the variable is a path to an existing, writeable file or directory

  • Try expressions and catch errors
